image.altText: The Australian dollar is closing in on 70 US cents.

items.synopsis: The Australian dollar is closing in on 70 US cents as another RBA rate rise is considered a done deal. Follow the latest financial news and analysis on our markets live blog.

title.children: Aussie dollar closes in on 70 US cents as rate rise bets firm, ASX opens higher

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Aviation operator Regional Express (Rex) has been placed into a trading halt ahead of an announcement being made by the airline. In a statement to the ASX, Rex will remain in a trading halt until Wednesday, unless the announcement is made by the regional airline sooner. Rex has recently expanded its services to cover routes between capital cities to compete with Virgin and Qantas. It also made headlines last week when a Rex flight intending to travel from Perth to Monkey Mia were told mid-flight that the plane wouldn't be stopping at the tourist spot and would continue to its final destination of Carnarvon, leaving some passengers on board stranded.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Rex enters trading halt ahead of announcement

children.content: Aviation operator Regional Express (Rex) has been placed into a trading halt ahead of an announcement being made by the airline.
In a statement to the ASX, Rex will remain in a trading halt until Wednesday, unless the announcement is made by the regional airline sooner.
Rex has recently expanded its services to cover routes between capital cities to compete with Virgin and Qantas.
It also made headlines last week when a Rex flight intending to travel from
Perth to Monkey Mia were told mid-flight that the plane wouldn't be stopping at the tourist spot and would continue to its final destination of Carnarvon
, leaving some passengers on board stranded.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The Australian dollar came within a whisker of passing 69 US cents on Friday, for the first time since mid-February, and is on a trajectory towards 70. The fortunes of the Aussie dollar have been largely linked to the relative interest rate outlook between Australia and the US. The US Federal Reserve paused its rate rises last week, with the benchmark rate sitting at 5-5.25%. Many traders expect one more rate hike at most before the Fed is done, with some now believing it is finished, although the Fed itself suggests there might be a couple more. The RBA's cash rate rose a couple of weeks ago to 4.1% in a move that surprised many in the markets. After last week's strong jobs numbers, the RBA is now priced in for at least one more rate hike by August and probably two more before it is done later this year. That would take the cash rate in Australia to 4.6%, which won't be too far behind the US Fed funds rate if the central bank there extends this month's pause over the coming months. That has seen the Australian dollar rise from recent lows around 65 US cents in May when traders thought the Reserve Bank might be done with rate hikes to the current level of 68.66 US cents .
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Australian dollar around four-month highs on interest rate outlook

children.content: The Australian dollar came within a whisker of passing 69 US cents on Friday, for the first time since mid-February, and is on a trajectory towards 70.

props.alt: The Aussie dollar has bounced back from recent lows around 65 US cents

children.content: The Aussie dollar has bounced back from recent lows around 65 US cents

The

in a move that surprised many in the markets.
After last week's strong jobs numbers, the
RBA is now priced in for at least one more rate hike by August and probably two more before it is done
later this year.
That would take the
cash rate in Australia to 4.6%
, which won't be too far behind the US Fed funds rate if the central bank there extends this month's pause over the coming months.
That has seen the Australian dollar rise from recent lows around 65 US cents in May when traders thought the Reserve Bank might be done with rate hikes to the
current level of 68.66 US cents

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The ASX has opened 0.3% higher, sitting at 7,274 points as if 10:20am (you can see the live figures in our pinned post at the top of the blog), with most sectors having some slight gains so far this morning. The healthcare sector is up 0.7%, while the education sector is also up 0.5%. So far the only sector that's in the red is basic materials, which is down 0.3%. It's early days, but here's the top five movers so far: Abacus Property Group +5.2% Karoon Energy +3.5% Capricorn Metals +1.9% Ansell +1.8% Domino's Pizza +1.5% And the five worst performers so far: Lake Resources -16.8% Iluka Resources -3.5% Chalice Mining -2.3% Core Lithium -1.9% Mineral Resources Ltd -1.6%
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: ASX opens higher, Lake Resources sheds nearly 17pc in early trade

children.content: The ASX has opened 0.3% higher, sitting at 7,274 points as if 10:20am (you can see the live figures in our pinned post at the top of the blog), with most sectors having some slight gains so far this morning.
The healthcare sector is up 0.7%, while the education sector is also up 0.5%.
So far the only sector that's in the red is basic materials, which is down 0.3%.
It's early days, but here's the top five movers so far:
Abacus Property Group +5.2%
Karoon Energy +3.5%
Capricorn Metals +1.9%
Ansell +1.8%
Domino's Pizza +1.5%
And the five worst performers so far:
Lake Resources -16.8%
Iluka Resources -3.5%
Chalice Mining -2.3%
Core Lithium -1.9%
Mineral Resources Ltd -1.6%
